newsitem.title: USA: Compuware sets two-for-one stock split.
newsitem.headline: Compuware sets two-for-one stock split.

text.p: Compuware Corp said its board of directors approved a two-for-one stock split, pending shareholder and regulatory approval of an increase in the company's authorized stock.

The computer software company also reported third quarter net income of $32.2 million, or $0.72 a share, compared with a year-earlier net loss of $2.4 million, or $0.06 a share. The year ago period included special charges for purchased research and development that came to $0.58 a share.
"We are pleased to once again to report strong growth across all product lines and professional services during the Company's third quarter," Compuware Chairman Peter Karmanos said in a statement.

He said the company's transition from a seller of tools for mainframe programmers to to a seller of software and professional services for end-users in all computing environments continues to build momentum.

"We believe Compuware's achievements in the third quarter offer strong evidence that the Company is well positioned to help our large corporate users successfully deploy client/server technology," Karmanos said.
